Assassin's Creed Chronicles: India is a singleplayer side view platform and stealth game in the Assassin's Creed Chronicles and Assassin's Creed series.

General information

Steam Community Discussions

Included with Ubisoft+. Trilogy also available.

Trilogy also available.
All versions require Ubisoft Connect DRM.

Essential improvements[edit]

Skip intro videos[edit]

Modify PCConsole-ACCEngine.ini[citation needed]
  1. Go to the configuration file(s) location.
  2. Open PCConsole-ACCEngine.ini.
  3. Comment the following lines by adding ; in front of them (or just delete them, since the game deletes the commented lines):
StartupMovies=ACC_Ubisoft_Ident_1080
StartupMovies=ACC_Climax_Ident_1080
StartupMovies=ACC_UE3AnimatedLogo_Ident
StartupMovies=ACC_Menu_Movie

Game data[edit]

Configuration file(s) location[edit]

System Location
Windows %USERPROFILE%\Documents\My Games\ACIndia\ACCGame\Config\
Steam Play (Linux) <SteamLibrary-folder>/steamapps/compatdata/359610/pfx/[Note 1]

Save game data location[edit]

System Location
Windows <Ubisoft-Connect-folder>\savegames\<user-id>\1847\
Steam <Ubisoft-Connect-folder>\savegames\<user-id>\1849\
Steam Play (Linux) <SteamLibrary-folder>/steamapps/compatdata/359610/pfx/[Note 1]

Anisotropic filtering (AF)[edit]

Anisotropic Filtering[citation needed]
  1. Go to the configuration file(s) location.
  2. Edit PCConsole-ACCSystemSettings.ini.
  3. Change MaxAnisotropy=4 to the desired value.
  4. Save and set the file to read-only.

High frame rate[edit]

Change frame rate smoothing[citation needed]
  1. Go to the configuration file(s) location.
  2. Open PCConsole-ACCEngine.ini.
  3. Search and change bSmoothFrameRate to FALSE or raise MaxSmoothedFrameRate value.
  4. Save file.
For more information, see the Unreal Engine 3 page.

Notes

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Notes regarding Steam Play (Linux) data:
    • File/folder structure within this directory reflects the path(s) listed for Windows and/or Steam game data.
    • Use Wine's registry editor to access any Windows registry paths.
    • The app ID (359610) may differ in some cases.
    • Treat backslashes as forward slashes.
    • See the glossary page for details on Windows data paths.

References

  1. ↑ Verified by User:Aemony on 2025-08-23
    Verified using RivaTuner Statistics Server (RTSS). Executable has no references to D3D10, but has multiple references to D3D11 and D3D9. D3D9 can be forced using -d3d9, while a non-functioning OpenGL mode can be forced using -opengl. -d3d10 does not exist, and only defaults to the D3D11 mode.
